statement.p: Atenolol has a half life of 6-7 hours depending on patient factors. For this problem use a half life of 6.6 hours. Suppose Victor is prescribed 25 mg/day. If Victor takes his first 25 mg dose on Monday morning, how much is expected in his blood Tuesday morning at the same time?

solution.p: The half-life model is \displaystyle{A}=\frac{{A}_{{0}}}{{{2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{h}}}}}} where \displaystyle{A}_{{0}} is the initial amount, \displaystyle{t} is the time elapsed, and \displaystyle{h} is the half-life. In this case \displaystyle{A}=\frac{{25}}{{{2}^{{\frac{{24}}{{6.6}}}}}}={2.0104139031397}\approx{2.0}.
